trans-unit.source: This type supports the WPF infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

To make a class animatable, it should derive from <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>, or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable"></xref>.
Applies the effect of a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> to a given dependency property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> to animate.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> that animates the property.
Applies the effect of a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> to a given dependency property.
The effect of the new on any current animations is determined by the value of the handoffBehavior parameter.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> to animate.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> that animates the property.
Determines how the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> will transition from or affect any current animations on the property.
Initiates an animation sequence for the <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> object, based on the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>.
The animation sequence is triggered once the next frame is rendered.
The object to animate.
The timeline with the necessary functionality to animate the property.

Initiates an animation sequence for the <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.object, based on both the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.HandoffBehavior"></xref>.
The animation sequence is triggered once the next frame is rendered.
The object to animate.
The timeline with the necessary functionality to tailor the new animation.
The object specifying the manner in which to interact with all relevant animation sequences.
Retrieves the base value of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> object.
Use this method instead of <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A> when you want to retrieve the non-animated value of an animated property.
This method takes advantage of the fact that [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] animations do not remove the target property's original value.
For more information, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
The object for which the base value is being requested.
The object representing the base value of Dp.
Gets a value that indicates whether this instance has any animated properties.
Note that this property returns `true` even if the associated animation is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ClockState.Stopped> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ClockState.Filling>.
`true` if a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock"></xref> is associated with at least one of the current object's properties; otherwise `false`.
